body.title: DOM4J The Flexible XML Framework for Java

header.p: DOM4J is an open and easy to use, interface-based Java API for navigating and manipulating XML documents.
DOM4J combines the best of DOM, SAX, XPath and the Java 2 platform to provide a flexible and powerful framework integrating XML and Java.
DOM4J extends the Java 2 Collections framework to handle XML documents allowing flexible plug and play implementations and has fully integrated XPath navigation support from anywhere in the model.

section.title: Getting Started
section.p: For a quick overview of DOM4J and how to use it try the reading the Quick Start Guide or browsing the FAQ or the online JavaDoc.
You can download the current $VERSION$ release or a nightly build via the download page.
Contributors are welcome to join this project. Once you've browsed the FAQ you could try sending an email to one of the mailing lists below or check out the project page.

section.title: Mailing Lists
section.p:
For DOM4J users there is an email list at
dom4j-user
where you can share ideas and experiences, ask for help, give us feedback or discuss your requirements.

For geeks and advanced techies there is an email list at
dom4j-dev
where you can make requests for new features or changes to the API, discuss alternate implementation strategies, submit patches or just talk about any relevant topic of the day.
